DwarfOperator000.synopsis: This goblin is wearing a pair of fancy breeches he stole off a dead dwarf. A dead dwarf that he's currently helping to cook, on a spit. The breeches have a poem inside that contains a clue the players might need to open a dungeon inside the goblin camp, but Klagga is unaware of this. He'd rather admire his own fashion sense and flirt than figure out what the poem means, and he can be convinced to sell it or give it away.

GoblinSleeper_02.synopsis: A drunk, sleeping goblin, disturbed by the player, trying to go back to sleep

GoblinKid002.synopsis: An unpleasant goblin kid, standing over and insulting the corpse of a dead adventurer. The adventurer killed his parents, but if players offer sympathy he'll mock them.

GoblinKid000.synopsis: A goblin kid, hanging out with two friends at the goblin camp near the corpse of a dead adventurer. He's trying to sound tough, like a cocky teenager impressing his friends.

Goblin003.synopsis: This goblin is a spectator - initially of a bard singing a song in which he's not partcularly interested, and later of a game of chicken chase

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime.synopsis: An unpleasant goblin kid's crime reaction on looting dead adventurer's body.

GoblinSleeper_01.synopsis: A drunk, sleeping goblin. If woken, he's tired and angry, and likely to attack the player

GoblinKid001.synopsis: a young goblin kid hanging out with his friends on the periphery of a party. Insulting and rude.

Ogre_00.synopsis: This ogre has two states: one where he's enjoying the festivities, and one where he is angry at the person who interrupted the festivities.

Goblin007.synopsis: A somewhat zealous goblin eager to tell us about the mark that the Absolute's followers have branded onto their flesh

Goblin001.synopsis: A goblin drinking merrily at a party - tipsy.

Goblin005.synopsis: A drunk goblin who is trying to get out of doing any more raiding
Goblin005.how_to_trigger: in Recon: teleport S_GOB_Festivities_Goblin_005for branded line - addTag BRANDED

DwarfOperator001.synopsis: This goblin is operating a spit, cooking a dead dwarf. He's in a festive area, where his friends are celebrating a recent raid. The dwarf was captured when attempting to steal something from the goblin camp, and he'll tell us a little about that.

Trader.synopsis: Grat is selling items laid out on a blanket in the middle of a drunken celebration in the goblin camp. He's not participating in the drinking - he expects to make a good bit of coin off his drunk mates.

Goblin000.synopsis: A goblin drinking at the festivities following a successful raid. Discusses the chicken chase game the goblins ar eplaying nearby as well as the general festivities.Not drunk yet - fairly relaxed.

Goblin004.synopsis: A goblin enjoying the festivities following a successful raid. Fairly relaxed, not very drunk yet. Not particularly interested in conversation - occupied with the game of chicken chase happening nearby, drinking and trying to forget a painful wound.

BugbearSleeper_00.synopsis: A sleeping bugbear is woken by the players hitting a nearby wall. Like a very angry drunk, woken up with a sore head. Guttural voice - not stupid-sounding, but savage and sinister.

Goblin006.synopsis: A goblin at a party who has had far too much to drink already. He's celebrating the raid in which the goblins stole all of the booze they're now working their way through.

Bugbear_Wanderer.synopsis: A very grumpy bugbear guard who'd rather be sleeping.

Goblin002.synopsis: This goblin is a chatty one, enjoying the party and making pleasant conversation. She assumes you're here for the same reasons she is - enjoying the spoils of a recent brutal raid.
Goblin002.how_to_trigger: teleport S_GOB_Festivities_Goblin_002talk to Tracker TakAfter Game:Debug Book > Misc Cheats > Give 1000 GP > talk to krolla > bet on chicken/owlbear > Win Gametalk to Tracker Tak

automatic_ordering.reasoning: After examining each session’s synopsis and trigger notes, several relationships become apparent. First, two DwarfOperator sessions seem to be two stages of the same NPC’s dialogue: initially, in DwarfOperator000 the goblin is seen admiring his stolen breeches while helping to cook a dead dwarf; later on in DwarfOperator001 he is operating the spit and giving additional details about the capture of the dwarf. This implies that DwarfOperator000 should occur before DwarfOperator001. Next, there is a split in the dialogue for the unpleasant goblin kid: the base session GoblinKid002 shows him standing over a corpse and insulting the dead adventurer, while an alternate dialogue, GoblinKid002_LootingCrime, is triggered in response to the player looting the body. These two represent mutually exclusive outcomes for the same situation. Similarly, several sessions describe different states of sleeping/drunk goblins (GoblinSleeper_00, GoblinSleeper_01, and GoblinSleeper_02). They appear to represent alternative states or responses of what is essentially the same NPC (or a similar situation) depending on whether the goblin is undisturbed, angrily roused, or just trying to resume sleep – hence only one of these would occur in a given playthrough. Finally, for the bugbear there are two versions – BugbearSleeper_01 which is encountered peacefully as a sleeping bugbear, and BugbearSleeper_00 which represents the same bugbear being disturbed and becoming angry – making these sessions mutually exclusive as well.

DwarfOperator000_8.speaker: Tracker Klagga

DwarfOperator000_8.context: NodeContext: Someone poisoned their beer and killed his mates. He's determined to catch the killer.

DwarfOperator000_58.speaker: Player

DwarfOperator000_79.speaker: Player

GoblinKid002_29.context: NodeContext: reacting to the player, who is a gith (an alien creature), asking about her parents. The question is weirdly worded and she thinks they're asking him to explain the birds and the bees

GoblinKid002_30.speaker: Gale
GoblinKid002_30.text: Loss holds hands with grief - even among goblins.

GoblinKid002_0.speaker: Player
GoblinKid002_0.text: Stop this - you're disrespecting the dead.

GoblinKid002_28.speaker: Eight
GoblinKid002_28.text: I'll disrespect you if you don't shut it!
GoblinKid002_28.context: NodeContext: doesn't really know what 'disrespect' means - thinks it's a violent action. Shouting at us

GoblinKid002_1.speaker: Eight
GoblinKid002_1.text: This nasty worg-pizzle killed my mum and dad! Made a bloody orphan of me.
GoblinKid002_1.context: NodeContext: Angry - 'worg-pizzle' is crude slang referring to a wolf-like animal's genitals. Pizzle rhymes with fizzle.

GoblinKid002_12.speaker: Eight
GoblinKid002_12.text: Ya got what ya wanted, didn't ya? Stop botherin' us.

GoblinKid002_17.speaker: Eight
GoblinKid002_17.text: Fine - take him, just leave us!

GoblinKid000_0.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000_0.text: Wot are you s'posed to be? You look like a dead elf wot got left out in the sun for too long.
GoblinKid000_0.context: NodeContext: sneering, mocking. He's a cocky teenager who just met a gith (alien creature; not well known) for the first time

GoblinKid000_11.speaker: Player
GoblinKid000_11.text: I am an alien warrior from another plane of existence.

GoblinKid000_29.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000_29.text: Sure you are. An' I'm king of the hobgoblins.
GoblinKid000_29.context: NodeContext: reacting to a player who made an outlandish claim, replying with one of his own. He's a smug teenager

GoblinKid000_23.speaker: Player
GoblinKid000_23.text: I'm a githyanki; a stranger to this land.

GoblinKid000_10.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000_10.text: There's plenty of weirdoes about - you'll fit right in, freakshow.
GoblinKid000_10.context: NodeContext: Mocking. He's replying to a player who just explained that they're from another plane of existence.

GoblinKid000_5.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000_5.text: That body's all yours - just leave us alone!

GoblinKid000_14.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000_14.text: You look like you think you're hard. Mess with us, and you'll end up like this bleeder.
GoblinKid000_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: gesturing toward or kicking the adventurer's corpse at his feetNodeContext: Cocky teenager, in a group of friends, trying to sound tougher than he is - standing over a corpse

GoblinKid000_16.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000_16.text: Ugh. You look like you've been kissin' a worg's backside.
GoblinKid000_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: waving his hand in front of his nose, exaggerating a bad smellNodeContext: disgusted and amused - reacting to player having dung smeared on their face. Worg is a wolf-like animal (

GoblinKid000_25.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000_25.text: Piss off, or you'll end up like this bleeder.
GoblinKid000_25.context: NodeContext: cocky, aggressive - 'this bleeder' is a dead adventurer at his feet

GoblinKid000_1.speaker: Player
GoblinKid000_1.text: Keep threatening me. See what happens.

GoblinKid000_4.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000_4.text: Oh,  you're real tough. Bullying a kid.
GoblinKid000_4.context: NodeContext: we fell for his bait and now he's mocking us

GoblinKid000_2.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000_2.text: Sod off or I'll fetch my mum. She was tough as worg meat before the Absolute came along.
GoblinKid000_2.context: NodeContext: mocking- Like a teenager doing a "my dad could beat up your dad" bit. Heavy emphasis on 'before' to set up the follow-up in the following line.

GoblinKid000_8.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000_8.text: Now... she could punch out a dragon!
GoblinKid000_8.context: NodeContext: Exaggerating but kind of believes it. Pause after 'now' as he punches a fist into his other palm

GoblinKid000_15.speaker: Player
GoblinKid000_15.text: Sorry - I don't want any trouble.

GoblinKid000_19.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000_19.text: Don't matter who he was. He ain't nothin' but a stain now.
GoblinKid000_19.context: NodeContext: referring to a dead adventurer at his feet - matter of fact

GoblinKid000_27.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000_27.text: Jus' like you'll be if you don't clear off.

GoblinKid000_6.speaker: Player
GoblinKid000_6.text: A warning, whelp. Do not threaten me.

GoblinKid000_13.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000_13.text: Whatcha gonna do about it? Run off and cry to yer spider-mum?
GoblinKid000_13.context: NodeContext: talking to a drow - 'spider-mum' refers to the drow goddess Lolth. This is a deeply dangerous and blasphemous thing to say, but he's too immature and cocky to realise he could be getting himself into serious trouble. Doesn't know boundaries.

GoblinKid000_3.speaker: Player
GoblinKid000_3.text: No. I'm going to cut out your tongue.

GoblinKid000_24.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000_24.text: Anuvver dirt-elf come to boss us around, eh? Bet I could break your face.
GoblinKid000_24.context: NodeContext: Cocky teenager, in a group of friends, trying to sound tougher than he is - standing over a corpse

Goblin003_0.speaker: Brawler Rot
Goblin003_0.text: Wass holdin' up the game? Chicken ain't dead is it?

Goblin003_1.speaker: Brawler Rot
Goblin003_1.text: Wish he was screamin' rather than singin'.
Goblin003_1.context: NodeContext: Grumbling, not pleased with the bard everyone else seems to love.

Goblin003_2.speaker: Brawler Rot
Goblin003_2.text: Wass holdin' up the game? Owlbear ain't dead is it?

Goblin003_3.speaker: Brawler Rot
Goblin003_3.text: Don't touch the booze. Some bastard poisoned it.

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_22.speaker: Eight
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_22.text: That's my corpse - I killed him. And you're next!
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: angry, attacks after this nodeNodeContext: Shouting at player and preparing to attack

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_24.speaker: Eight
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_24.text: Oi, get off! I killed him - he's mine!
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_24.context: CinematicNodeContext: planer knelt looting bodyNodeContext: wave hands to shoo looting player.

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_41.speaker: Narrator
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_41.text: *The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_26.speaker: Narrator
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_26.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_5.speaker: Narrator
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_5.text: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_8.speaker: Player
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_8.text: Nothing is yours. Find another corpse.

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_32.speaker: Eight
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_32.text: I'll - I'll leave him to you, uh, your highness.

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_30.speaker: Player
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_30.text: You're wasting your time with this one. There are corpses outside with far more loot.

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_17.speaker: Eight
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_17.text: There is? Shite, let's go, guys, 'fore One realises.

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_29.speaker: Player
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_29.text: I'll do what I want - and you will find another corpse.

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_3.speaker: Eight
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_3.text: That - that was that thing that Gut did! The True Soul thing!
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_3.context: NodeContext: The player just mind-controlled the goblin kid, and he knows this is something only the leaders of their cult can do, so he's shocked and in awe.

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_20.speaker: Narrator
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_20.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_39.speaker: Narrator
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_39.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_13.speaker: Narrator
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_13.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_35.speaker: Narrator
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_35.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_42.speaker: Narrator
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_42.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_0.speaker: Narrator
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_0.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_38.speaker: Eight
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_38.text: I'll - I'll leave him to you, uh, True Soul.

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_15.speaker: Narrator
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_15.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_10.speaker: Eight
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_10.text: Hah! Hear that? We're gonna get another corpse soon enough.

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_36.speaker: Player
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_36.text: Boss' orders. I'm collecting his loot.

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_4.speaker: Eight
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_4.text: Gah - we never get anything! C'mon. Let's see if we can snatch that stupid chicken.

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_12.speaker: Eight
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_12.text: Oh yeah? Ya know what Ragzlin's orders are? Kill all the stinkin' thieves.

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_9.speaker: Player
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_9.text: Or what? I'll run you through before you can cry for your mother.

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_16.speaker: Eight
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_16.text: Oh yeah? I don't need my mum to deal with some crummy pig like you.

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_40.speaker: Eight
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_40.text: Take him. I'll just cut your throat when you ain't looking, and get all your stuff, then.
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_40.context: NodeContext: slide hand along neck to jesutre the cut. be aware of hands clipping into the modles neck so give it some space if possible

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_25.speaker: Eight
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_25.text: This meatbag might have nothin' but a few paper scraps, but I ain't gonna let no one get 'em.
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_25.context: NodeContext: do not look around, the cinematics will cover this. but try covay the thought with body language as much as possible

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_7.speaker: Eight
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_7.text: If One comes braggin' about what she's found, at least I got somethin' to show her.
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_7.context: NodeContext: do not look around, the cinematics will cover this. but try covay the thought with body language as much as possible

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_2.speaker: Eight
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_2.text: Wh-what's that? Ya tryna explode my head? I'll kill ya!

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_23.speaker: Player
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime_23.text: I'll do what I want - and you will find another corpse.

GoblinSleeper_01_18.speaker: Tracker Dullwill

GoblinSleeper_01_19.speaker: Tracker Dullwill
GoblinSleeper_01_19.context: NodeContext: goblin is drunk and sleeping, belches when disturbed but doesn't wake

GoblinSleeper_01_27.speaker: Tracker Dullwill

GoblinSleeper_01_0.speaker: Narrator

GoblinSleeper_01_2.speaker: Player
GoblinSleeper_01_2.text: Relax, everything's fine. Just go back to sleep.

GoblinSleeper_01_26.speaker: Player

GoblinSleeper_01_5.context: NodeContext: with a yawn, preparing to go back to sleep

GoblinSleeper_01_29.context: NodeContext: sleepily agreeing to an order

GoblinSleeper_01_23.speaker: Narrator
GoblinSleeper_01_23.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

GoblinSleeper_01_7.speaker: Tracker Dullwill
GoblinSleeper_01_7.text: Who the hells are you, giving me orders? I'll cut ya!
GoblinSleeper_01_7.context: NodeContext: just woke up, furious, about to attack the player

GoblinSleeper_01_21.speaker: Narrator

GoblinKid001_0.speaker: Five
GoblinKid001_0.context: NodeContext: "horns" line is a kid impressed by an adult who has ACTUAL HORNS - other line is dismissive and bratty

GoblinKid001_1.speaker: Five
GoblinKid001_1.text: You stink worse than a bugbear's arse.

GoblinKid001_2.speaker: Five
GoblinKid001_2.text: I won't do nothin'! Please stop!

GoblinKid001_4.speaker: Five

Ogre_00_1.speaker: Guard Gurgon
Ogre_00_1.text: Here has music, beer, dance! You dance too.

Ogre_00_2.speaker: Guard Gurgon
Ogre_00_2.text: Someone kill beer. No more fun - I smash him.
Ogre_00_2.context: NodeContext: The ogre is mad becuase someone poisoned the beer tub and killed his friends. He's saying that the fun is over and he'll kill the person who did it.

Goblin007_8.speaker: Warlock Gurk
Goblin007_8.text: We'll show the damn rat that poisoned us. Mark my words. Ya don't mess with the Absolute.
Goblin007_8.context: NodeContext: Someone poisoned his mates. He's determined to find the killer.

Goblin007_11.speaker: Warlock Gurk
Goblin007_11.text: Best see the priestess and get branded, mucker.
Goblin007_11.context: NodeContext: He has been branded (by choice) and his arm is badly burned. He's too drunk to care too much though

Goblin007_12.speaker: Player
Goblin007_12.text: You let her burn you? Why?

Goblin007_5.speaker: Warlock Gurk
Goblin007_5.text: Mark of the Absolute, innit? Shows our devotion to 'er.
Goblin007_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: He holds out his hand, showing the brandNodeContext: Too drunk to be overly bothered, but mildly annoyed

Goblin007_23.speaker: Warlock Gurk
Goblin007_23.text: Makes it easier to decide who we kill and who we don't, too - so best get a move on, eh?

Goblin007_1.speaker: Player
Goblin007_1.text: Can this priestess heal people too, or does she just brand them?

Goblin007_14.speaker: Warlock Gurk
Goblin007_14.text: Heh. Seen 'er carve more folk than she's cured. Still, she's a Chosen o' the Absolute now.

Goblin007_4.speaker: Warlock Gurk
Goblin007_4.text: See for y'self. Head inside, and follow the sound o' squealin' novices.

Goblin007_0.speaker: Warlock Gurk
Goblin007_0.text: Hah! Knew I could smell sumfin' roasted. Thought it were just the dwarf.
Goblin007_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at player's mark.NodeContext: Amused, drunk

Goblin007_22.speaker: Warlock Gurk
Goblin007_22.text: Fink the Absolute wants me to 'ave another drink.

Goblin007_25.speaker: Warlock Gurk
Goblin007_25.text: Grab a drink afore you see the priestess, mucker. The brandin' stings sumfin' proper.
Goblin007_25.context: NodeContext: He has been branded (by choice) and his arm is badly burned. He's too drunk to care too much though

Goblin007_26.speaker: Warlock Gurk
Goblin007_26.text: Hey, can I see yer brand? The priestess gave me one, and I think she did it wrong.
Goblin007_26.context: NodeContext: He has been branded (by choice) and his arm is badly burned. He's too drunk to care too much though

Goblin007_13.speaker: Player
Goblin007_13.text: Priestess? Is she a healer, too?

Goblin007_21.speaker: Warlock Gurk
Goblin007_21.text: Heh. Seen 'er carve more folk than she's cured. Still, she's a Chosen o' the Absolute now.

Goblin007_10.speaker: Warlock Gurk
Goblin007_10.text: Hold on. I was askin' you sumfin', wasn't I?
Goblin007_10.context: NodeContext: Drunk, trying to remember what they were talking about.

Goblin007_9.speaker: Player
Goblin007_9.text: You wanted to see my brand. Here, take a look.

Goblin007_20.speaker: Player
Goblin007_20.text: You wanted to see a brand that I don't have.

Goblin007_3.speaker: Player
Goblin007_3.text: I don't have a brand. Yet.

Goblin007_24.speaker: Warlock Gurk
Goblin007_24.text: Well, go get one inside, then! But 'ave a drink first. It stings sumfin' proper.

Goblin007_16.speaker: Warlock Gurk
Goblin007_16.text: Just like I thought. Yers is prettier 'n mine. S'pose it does the job, though.
Goblin007_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: NPC looks at player's mark. NodeContext: Envious

Goblin001_0.speaker: Warrior Sul
Goblin001_0.text: This ale tastes like hobgoblin spit. Who's been pukin' in the barrel?

Goblin001_1.speaker: Warrior Sul
Goblin001_1.text: Oi. Watch you don't spill my beer, or I'll cut ya.

Goblin001_2.speaker: Warrior Sul
Goblin001_2.text: Party's over, mate. Somethin's wrong with the booze.

Goblin005_4.speaker: Tracker Puli
Goblin005_4.text: Hey... hey! You ain't roundin' me up for no raid. No way. I'm DRINKIN'!
Goblin005_4.context: NodeContext: She's boozy and aggressive - especially if you try to stop her having another drink. Friendly as could be if you join her in a drink.

Goblin005_15.speaker: Tracker Puli
Goblin005_15.context: NodeContext: Imagine her raising a tankard of ale and drunkenly celebrating

Goblin005_0.speaker: Player
Goblin005_0.text: You'll need to sober up before another raid.

Goblin005_12.speaker: Tracker Puli
Goblin005_12.text: Tha's wot I said! Too sozzled for slicin' folks.
Goblin005_12.context: NodeContext: Pleased to have the player's support

Goblin005_6.speaker: Tracker Puli
Goblin005_6.text: I'd sleep it off in the worg pens... but that place is a madhouse right now.

Goblin005_2.speaker: Player
Goblin005_2.text: Show your brand and tell her to get moving.

Goblin005_10.speaker: Tracker Puli
Goblin005_10.text: Wot? Really? Auggh... gizza break. My 'ed's mashed.
Goblin005_10.context: NodeContext: drunk, flustered - like someone waking up with a hangover and being told they need to get to work right now

Goblin005_1.speaker: Player
Goblin005_1.text: Raiding is an honour. You are a disgrace.

Goblin005_8.speaker: Tracker Puli
Goblin005_8.text: Raid 'ard, party 'arder, tha's what I say... ain't no dishgrace in tha'.

Goblin005_9.speaker: Tracker Puli
Goblin005_9.text: Sorry yer drowship... didn't mean nothin' by it. I'm here to serve.

Goblin005_7.speaker: Tracker Puli
Goblin005_7.text: My head's mashed, guts are burnin'... hope I ain't poisoned.

Goblin005_11.speaker: Tracker Puli
Goblin005_11.text: Piss off, I've got coin on this game!

Goblin005_13.speaker: Tracker Puli
Goblin005_13.text: You bettin' on the game too, majesty?

Goblin005_14.speaker: Tracker Puli
Goblin005_14.text: Do I know you? Yeah... we're mates, ain't we.

DwarfOperator001_5.text: Get ready to fight or get out. Party's over.

DwarfOperator001_27.context: NodeContext: he's cooking a dead dwarf on a spit - deferential because we're a drow

DwarfOperator001_37.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001_37.text: D'ya fancy a hunk of dwarf meat, under-dweller? He ain't ready yet.
DwarfOperator001_37.context: NodeContext: he's cooking a dead dwarf on a spit - 'under-dweller' refers to the fact the player is a duergar, a dark dwarf

DwarfOperator001_24.speaker: Player
DwarfOperator001_24.text: Smells delicious. Reminds me of my childhood.

DwarfOperator001_3.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001_3.text: Figured you'd enjoy it. Bet you wish you'd been 'ere to skewer the ugly bastard.
DwarfOperator001_3.context: NodeContext: he's cooking a dead dwarf on a spit, responding to a duergar player and acknowledging their hatred of dwarves

DwarfOperator001_2.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001_2.text: Prefer human meat myself. Juicier. Yer makin' me salivate just standin' there.
DwarfOperator001_2.context: NodeContext: talking to a human character while salivating about eating humans. He doesn't think there's anything particularly untoward about wanting to eat us.

DwarfOperator001_41.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001_41.text: One of his mates woz a tasty-lookin' long pig - but he ain't ready for the spit yet.
DwarfOperator001_41.context: NodeContext: telling us about a human that the goblins have captured. Salivating at the prospect of eating him.

DwarfOperator001_14.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001_14.text: Yer not allergic to dwarf-flesh or anything, are ya?
DwarfOperator001_14.context: NodeContext: concerned - he's responding to a duergar character and is concerned their hatred of dwarves might make them allergic to the meat. He's not very bright

DwarfOperator001_6.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001_6.text: That's just how dwarves is. Probably shoulda shaved him before cookin' him.
DwarfOperator001_6.context: NodeContext: cooking a dead dwarf and acknowledging it's disgusting

DwarfOperator001_40.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001_40.context: NodeContext: he's cooking a dead dwarf on a spit - salivating at the prospect of human meat

DwarfOperator001_16.speaker: Player
DwarfOperator001_16.text: Where did you find a dwarf?

DwarfOperator001_34.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001_34.text: He found us! Dunno wot he was doin' 'ere or where he came from.
DwarfOperator001_34.context: NodeContext: responding to player asking about the dead dwarf he's cooking

DwarfOperator001_33.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001_33.text: Lads inside are tryin' to get answers out of one of his mates.
DwarfOperator001_33.context: NodeContext: 'tryin' to get answers' means 'torturing'. He's enjoying telling us this.

DwarfOperator001_42.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001_42.text: Scabby gang of tomb-robbers sniffin' around for loot. We put the fear of the Absolute in 'em.
DwarfOperator001_42.context: NodeContext: talking about some adventurers the goblins captured/killed, pleased with himself

DwarfOperator001_32.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001_32.text: Some managed to scarper, but the rest are all carved up... or wishin' they was.
DwarfOperator001_32.context: NodeContext: talking about some adventurers the goblins captured/killed, pleased with himself

DwarfOperator001_31.speaker: Player
DwarfOperator001_31.text: Was one of his 'mates' a druid?

DwarfOperator001_26.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001_26.text: Nah. Druids are all beardy and woodsy, ain't they? This lot were a scabby gang of tomb-robbers.
DwarfOperator001_26.context: NodeContext: responding to a question about a druid, who looked frail but wasn't. So he's building up to a reveal here (warg is a wolf-like creature)

DwarfOperator001_44.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001_44.text: Had a big ol' warbear with 'em, though. Took five of our meanest lashers to chain it up.
DwarfOperator001_44.context: NodeContext: mock surprise - he's enjoying this twist in the tale he's telling. Lashers are high-tier goblins with whips.

DwarfOperator001_17.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001_17.text: We'll beat the fight out of it, and make it one of our own.

DwarfOperator001_36.speaker: Player
DwarfOperator001_36.text: I can get you answers. Where's the prisoner?

DwarfOperator001_19.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001_19.text: Thanks, True Soul. He'll probably spill his guts as soon as he claps eyes on ya!
DwarfOperator001_19.context: NodeContext: In awe - responding to a drow he just offered to help his friends torture somebody

DwarfOperator001_8.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001_8.text: He's inside. Keep to the right... an' follow the screams.
DwarfOperator001_8.context: NodeContext: with a beat before 'an' follow the screams'. He's relishing giving us this information, directing us to a torture victim

DwarfOperator001_30.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001_30.text: Enjoy pokin' holes in people do ya?
DwarfOperator001_30.context: NodeContext: amused, we just told him we're willing to help his friends torture somebody

DwarfOperator001_12.speaker: Player
DwarfOperator001_12.text: Step away from the pit. Now.

DwarfOperator001_22.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001_22.text: Ah, bugger off wiv yer attitude. He 'ad it comin' to 'im.
DwarfOperator001_22.context: NodeContext: Responding to a dwarf player who just called him out for cooking a dwarf. He's amused rather than annoyed

DwarfOperator001_7.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001_7.text: An' if you don't watch yer tongue, I'll chuck that on the fire an' all.
DwarfOperator001_7.context: NodeContext: Responding to a dwarf player who just called him out for cooking a dwarf. He's amused rather than annoyed

DwarfOperator001_11.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001_11.text: Tha's the spirit! I ate goblin once. Me brother. Wouldn't recommend it. All grease and gristle.
DwarfOperator001_11.context: NodeContext: thoughtful; he's talking about eating his brother, but let's assume his brother was already dead and it was just a convenient meal

DwarfOperator001_20.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001_20.text: What you really want is a good bit of human meat, with all the trimmings.
DwarfOperator001_20.context: NodeContext: thoughtful: he just calmly told us he ate his own brother - now he's giving us an honest assessment of the taste

DwarfOperator001_35.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001_35.text: One of this fella's mates woz a tasty-lookin' morsel, but he ain't ready for the spit yet.

DwarfOperator001_23.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001_23.text: Lads have got 'im inside for questionin'. Heh-heh-heh.
DwarfOperator001_23.context: NodeContext: 'Questionin' means torturing. And he's very amused by this

DwarfOperator001_38.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001_38.text: Buzz off - gotta concentrate on the meat.
DwarfOperator001_38.context: NodeContext: he's cooking a dead dwarf on a spit, needs to concentrate

DwarfOperator001_39.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001_39.text: Sorry, True Soul. Meat ain't ready yet - dwarves take an age to roast.
DwarfOperator001_39.context: NodeContext: he's cooking a dead dwarf on a spit - the greeting refers to the fact the player is a drow, a race he is afraid of and respects

DwarfOperator001_43.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001_43.text: That dwarf was still half-raw. Who ate it?

BugbearSleeper_01_0.speaker: Teghun
BugbearSleeper_01_0.context: NodeContext: A sleeping bugbear makes a snarling snoring sound

Trader_1.speaker: Grat the Trader
Trader_1.text: Be careful, your gloriousness. Someone's got it out for us.
Trader_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes the player suspciously.NodeContext: Suspicious.

Trader_4.speaker: Grat the Trader
Trader_4.text: I got stuff if you got coin.

Trader_5.speaker: Grat the Trader
Trader_5.text: You look like you got something jingling in your pocket.
Trader_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing in front of his goods, laid out on a blanket

Trader_14.speaker: Player
Trader_14.text: Let me see what you have.

Trader_8.speaker: Grat the Trader
Trader_8.text: Get movin'. I got other customers.

Trader_0.speaker: Player
Trader_0.text: Quite the trove. How'd you get your hands on all this?

Trader_9.speaker: Grat the Trader
Trader_9.text: Nicked 'em off the dead, didn't I?

Trader_12.speaker: Grat the Trader
Trader_12.text: Erh, I mean - raid spoils, your majesticality.
Trader_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wide-eyed, bowingNodeContext: Regretting his choice of words

Trader_6.speaker: Grat the Trader
Trader_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes the player suspciously.NodeContext: Suspicious.

Trader_10.speaker: Grat the Trader
Trader_10.text: Welcome, your greatness. I got some good stuff, if you're lookin' to buy.
Trader_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing in front of his goods, laid out on a blanketNodeContext: Making a sales pitch to his superior

Trader_11.speaker: Grat the Trader
Trader_11.text: Your greatness. Somethin' catch your eye?
Trader_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bows a bit when he says 'your greatness'NodeContext: 'Your greatness' is said like an honorific.

Goblin000_0.speaker: Devout Mezzka
Goblin000_0.text: Wanna play, yer honour? Krolla will get you started.

Goblin000_1.speaker: Devout Mezzka
Goblin000_1.text: You hungry? The dwarf's gettin' good an' crispy.

Goblin000_2.speaker: Devout Mezzka
Goblin000_2.text: You feelin' all right? That ale was rotten.

Goblin000_3.speaker: Devout Mezzka
Goblin000_3.text: I ain't playin'. Got knifed at the inn; wound ain't scabbed over yet.

Goblin000_4.speaker: Devout Mezzka
Goblin000_4.text: If you fancy playin', talk to Krolla.
Goblin000_4.context: NodeContext: He thinks he's the best runner in the camp; arrogant

Goblin004_0.speaker: Sharp-Eye Mirg
Goblin004_0.text: Quit pesterin' me - I'm tryin' to watch the game!
Goblin004_0.context: InternalNodeContext: Watching the chaseNodeContext: Friendly.

Goblin004_1.speaker: Sharp-Eye Mirg
Goblin004_1.text: Booze is s'posed to fix everythin', but that stuff is deadly.
Goblin004_1.context: NodeContext: anxious, shocked - some of her friends died after drinking poisoned beer

Goblin004_2.speaker: Sharp-Eye Mirg
Goblin004_2.text: I must be more sloshed than I thought... Y'look like... like nuffin' I ever seen before.

Goblin004_3.speaker: Sharp-Eye Mirg
Goblin004_3.text: Make yerself comfy, yer drowship. The game's just gettin' good.
Goblin004_3.context: InternalNodeContext: Watching the chaseNodeContext: Friendly.

Goblin004_4.speaker: Sharp-Eye Mirg
Goblin004_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raising a tankard - cheers!NodeContext: Raising a tankard - cheers!

Goblin004_5.speaker: Sharp-Eye Mirg
Goblin004_5.text: Bloody arm is killin' me. 'Ere's to the best sedative there is - BOOZE.

BugbearSleeper_00_13.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00_13.text: Go away, True Soul. I need sleep.
BugbearSleeper_00_13.context: NodeContext: just woke, tired and frustrated

BugbearSleeper_00_16.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00_16.text: Go away, drow. I need sleep.
BugbearSleeper_00_16.context: NodeContext: just woke, tired and frustrated

BugbearSleeper_00_31.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00_31.text: Vaws-hak. My head hurts bad. You crash about like a drunken ogre.
BugbearSleeper_00_31.context: CinematicNodeContext: perhaps stmik walks into shot if the player is hitting the wall.NodeContext: (Vors-hack) means death - here delievered as an angry curse on waking. Not shouted. Seeting with anger, just woke and has a bad headache from drinking

BugbearSleeper_00_41.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00_41.text: Didn't think drow were so clumsy. Leave us to rest.
BugbearSleeper_00_41.context: NodeContext: annoyed, but doesn't want to start a fight with a drow so trying to appease

BugbearSleeper_00_19.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00_19.text: I'll rip your tongue, break your legs, make you quiet.
BugbearSleeper_00_19.context: NodeContext: increasing fury on the rhythm of these three phrases, but quietly sinister, not shouted

BugbearSleeper_00_30.speaker: Narrator
BugbearSleeper_00_30.text: *The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*

BugbearSleeper_00_24.speaker: Player
BugbearSleeper_00_24.text: Go back to sleep before I put you to sleep.

BugbearSleeper_00_42.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00_42.text: You are right. You are strong. But if you wake me again, I will kill you.
BugbearSleeper_00_42.context: NodeContext: With a shake of the head - backing down from a fight. Sinister smile on final phrase

BugbearSleeper_00_20.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00_20.text: Too much talking. Too much noise. Glath, glath. You die now!
BugbearSleeper_00_20.context: NodeContext: Shaking away the drunkenness as he prepares to fight. glath (glaff) means 'blood', here it's a threat - 'you will bleed'.

BugbearSleeper_00_36.speaker: Player
BugbearSleeper_00_36.text: Sleep is for the weak. I could have killed you where you lay.

BugbearSleeper_00_12.speaker: Player
BugbearSleeper_00_12.text: Huh? I was sleeping with the rest of you. No idea who made that racket.

BugbearSleeper_00_27.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00_27.text: Stupid pests. The next person that wakes me dies.
BugbearSleeper_00_27.context: NodeContext: Rubbing his head to clear a headache and sleepiness. Has just been convinced that 'goblins' made the noise that woke him and is annoyed but isn't going to do anything about it

BugbearSleeper_00_3.speaker: Player
BugbearSleeper_00_3.text: Sorry - I thought you might need fresh drinks.

BugbearSleeper_00_7.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00_7.text: Yes. Drink will help me to sleep again.
BugbearSleeper_00_7.context: NodeContext: Drunk and tired, satisfied to have been offered alcohol

BugbearSleeper_00_34.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00_34.text: What did you bring for me?
BugbearSleeper_00_34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Checking his inventory - maybe shot from waist up, looking down at hands as we're supposed to have passed him somethingNodeContext: thoughtful

BugbearSleeper_00_15.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00_15.text: Good. Go now. And do not wake me again.
BugbearSleeper_00_15.context: NodeContext: satisfied, dismissively waves us away

BugbearSleeper_00_14.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00_14.context: NodeContext: 'nothing' is a reaction to not receiving the booze he was promised. He's furious.

BugbearSleeper_00_21.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00_21.text: Rather break bones than drink more. Your bones.
BugbearSleeper_00_21.context: NodeContext: tired and annoyed, about to attack us

BugbearSleeper_00_40.speaker: Player
BugbearSleeper_00_40.text: You dare speak to me like that? Go back to sleep.

BugbearSleeper_00_17.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00_17.text: I don't take orders from you. Kill 'em!
BugbearSleeper_00_17.context: NodeContext: angry, shouting to nearby goblins to attack on final phrase

BugbearSleeper_00_33.speaker: Narrator
BugbearSleeper_00_33.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

BugbearSleeper_00_22.speaker: Player
BugbearSleeper_00_22.text: You dare speak to me like that? Go back to sleep.

BugbearSleeper_00_5.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00_5.text: I hear the Absolute in you.

BugbearSleeper_00_4.speaker: Narrator
BugbearSleeper_00_4.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

BugbearSleeper_00_45.speaker: Narrator
BugbearSleeper_00_45.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

BugbearSleeper_00_43.speaker: Narrator
BugbearSleeper_00_43.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

BugbearSleeper_00_23.speaker: Narrator
BugbearSleeper_00_23.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

BugbearSleeper_00_6.speaker: Narrator
BugbearSleeper_00_6.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

BugbearSleeper_00_28.speaker: Narrator
BugbearSleeper_00_28.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*

BugbearSleeper_00_1.speaker: Narrator
BugbearSleeper_00_1.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

BugbearSleeper_00_38.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00_38.text: Do not disturb me again, True Soul.

BugbearSleeper_00_37.speaker: Narrator
BugbearSleeper_00_37.text: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*

BugbearSleeper_00_32.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00_32.context: NodeContext: Goblin language words muttered in his sleep (Grash rhymes with crash, a-rah-ga, hard g on 'ghist' and pok rhymes with lock)

BugbearSleeper_00_39.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00_39.text: No more excuses. I'll crack your skull!
BugbearSleeper_00_39.context: NodeContext: just woke up with a bad hangover, angry enough to attack us

Goblin006_4.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006_4.text: I ain't never drinkin' again. Never.

Goblin006_9.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006_9.text: Awshh... drink's goin' straight through me...
Goblin006_9.context: NodeContext: drunk, to the point he's slightly unsteady on his feet

Goblin006_11.speaker: Player
Goblin006_11.text: Seems like quite the party - enjoy it!

Goblin006_0.speaker: Player
Goblin006_0.text: The only cure is drinking more - as fast as you can.

Goblin006_6.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006_6.text: That's the plan! We looted an entire inn - brought back enough booze to drown a dragon.
Goblin006_6.context: NodeContext: drunk and reacting to a drow player - explaining the reasons for the party with respect and excitement

Goblin006_1.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006_1.text: That's the plan! We looted an entire inn - brought back enough booze to drown a dragon.
Goblin006_1.context: NodeContext: drunk - explaining the reasons for the party with respect and excitement

Goblin006_8.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006_8.text: Here's to them we nicked it off! Down one mug of ale for every throat we cut!
Goblin006_8.context: NodeContext: as if proposing a toast; he's drinking and celebrating

Goblin006_3.speaker: Player
Goblin006_3.text: Take it easy or you'll regret it in the morning.

Goblin006_10.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006_10.text: Gobs don't get hangovers. Just big greasy poundin' headaches.
Goblin006_10.context: NodeContext: drunk, explaining to a drow player that he can handle his drink

Goblin006_7.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006_7.text: That's elves for you. Always thinkin' of tomorrow.

Goblin006_5.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006_5.text: Don't be soft. We looted an entire inn - brought back enough booze to drown a dragon.
Goblin006_5.context: NodeContext: drunk, scornful, explaining the reasons for the party with respect and excitement

Bugbear_Wanderer_2.speaker: Bao'ek'nuk
Bugbear_Wanderer_2.text: You find the ones who poisoned that beer, you bring 'em to me. I'll take their heads for free.

Bugbear_Wanderer_0.speaker: Bao'ek'nuk
Bugbear_Wanderer_0.text: Poisonin' the only good thing in this dump...
Bugbear_Wanderer_0.context: NodeContext: grumbled, not really to the player.

Bugbear_Wanderer_3.speaker: Bao'ek'nuk
Bugbear_Wanderer_3.text: I ain't paid to talk. Keep walkin'.

Goblin002_3.speaker: Tracker Tak
Goblin002_3.text: Watch yerself - there's somethin' rotten in the booze.

Goblin002_7.speaker: Tracker Tak
Goblin002_7.text: Pish. Pure pish. N'ain't even drunk, see?
Goblin002_7.context: NodeContext: Acting like the alcohol is to weak to get drunk on. Very very drunk nonetheless.

Goblin002_13.speaker: Tracker Tak
Goblin002_13.text: 'Avin' a drink? 'S all the sweeter when it's free, innit?
Goblin002_13.context: NodeContext: Nastily amused, referencing the fact that they burned an inn down to get the drink. Treating you like you're in on the joke.

Goblin002_2.speaker: Tracker Tak
Goblin002_2.context: NodeContext: Pointing out that even if the alcohol was free, it's still weird foreign stuff.

Goblin002_10.speaker: Tracker Tak
Goblin002_10.text: That inn was askin' for a burnin', sellin' this muck. Ain't even chewy.
Goblin002_10.context: NodeContext: Shaking her head, rueful. Attitude is 'would you believe it? It isn't even chewy!'

Goblin002_12.speaker: Player
Goblin002_12.text: Free? Where did you get it all?

Goblin002_0.speaker: Tracker Tak
Goblin002_0.text: Where the 'ell do you get yours? From an inn, numpty.
Goblin002_0.context: NodeContext: Gently mocking you, as if you're being silly. Spoken fondly.

Goblin002_14.speaker: Tracker Tak
Goblin002_14.text: 'Course you won't find much there now. Took all the good stuff afore we burned it.
Goblin002_14.context: NodeContext: Fondly remembering the raid and the spoils.

Goblin002_1.speaker: Player
Goblin002_1.text: Is it? Looks like swill to me.

Goblin002_8.speaker: Tracker Tak
Goblin002_8.text: Aye, but can't expect proper stuff from them fancy inns, can ya?

Goblin002_4.speaker: Tracker Tak
Goblin002_4.text: I swear, I got more dizzy from the smoke when we burned the place down.
Goblin002_4.context: NodeContext: Sharing a joke with you about how weak the ale is.

Goblin002_6.speaker: Tracker Tak
Goblin002_6.text: That some fancy elf brew, is it? Never know, might 'ave it.
Goblin002_6.context: NodeContext: Oblivious, continuing on blithely anyway. Trying to be helpful even though she's missing the reference / your disgust.

Goblin002_11.speaker: Tracker Tak
Goblin002_11.text: We lifted all sorts from that inn afore we burned it.
